Dispute_Type: Civil dispute involving intellectual property rights
Legal_Issue: Whether a plaintiff can maintain an action indefinitely as leverage without intent to proceed
Procedural_Stage: Dismissal for want of prosecution and abuse of process
Evidence_Assessment: Plaintiffs delayed proceedings for three years and did not actively pursue litigation
Burden_of_Proof: On plaintiffs to show cause why action should not be dismissed
Credibility_Factor: Lack of genuine intent by plaintiffs to prosecute the claim
Legal_Rule: Actions may be dismissed for inordinate delay, lack of intent to proceed, or abuse of process
Standard_of_Review: Judicial discretion under case management principles
Procedural_Issue: Inordinate delay and failure to advance the litigation
Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached; dismissal based on procedural grounds
Review_Standard: Abuse of process and fairness under court rules
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Plaintiffs given opportunity to show cause before dismissal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Three-year delay, lack of settlement, no active litigation steps
Legal_Framework: Federal Court rules on case management and abuse of process
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs failed to demonstrate intent to proceed
Defendant_Response: Motion likely raised based on delay and inactivity
Evidence_Type: Procedural history, timelines, lack of filings or motions
Remedy_Requested: Dismissal of action for want of prosecution
Resolution_Mechanism: Show cause order leading to dismissal
Legal_Provision: Rules regarding abuse of process and case management
Legal_Provision_Cited: Federal Court rules on dismissal for delay and abuse of process
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Inordinate delay, lack of intent to proceed, abuse of process
Applicable_Process: Case management and procedural dismissal process
Governing_Rule: Federal Court Rules concerning dismissal for non-prosecution
